message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CY

This paper deals with the privacy concerns in Location-Based Services (LBSs), which is a topic closely related to computer security (cs.CR). The paper proposes a technique to reduce the number of constraints in the optimal method for protecting location privacy, which involves linear optimization techniques. This technique can be seen as a data management problem (cs.DB) since it aims to reduce the computational complexity of the method. The paper also discusses the trade-off between privacy and utility, which is a topic in machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The proposed technique involves probabilistic methods, which are commonly used in data mining and machine learning (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with the practical aspects of the proposed technique, such as the acceptable level of utility loss, which can be seen as a topic in cyber-physical systems (cs.CY).
